summary: Maurice Hyman Halperin was a former OSS official and Boston University professor suspected of Soviet espionage and working for the Soviet government. The documents indicate that the CIA and FBI investigated him due to his past activities and associations, including his time in Mexico. He is connected to investigations into American Communists in Mexico. A source reported his address in Cuba in 1962. His file was reviewed by the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA).
significance: Maurice Halperin's significance in the JFK context stems from the HSCA's review of his file, suggesting a potential, though unspecified, connection to the assassination investigation. His alleged ties to Soviet espionage and his associations with individuals investigated for communist activities in Mexico may have led to scrutiny by the HSCA.
